bottom: I am an astronaut. Today, I was performing a mission in space when I suddenly discovered that the pants of my spacesuit were torn. I was exposed to the vacuum and lack of oxygen in space and died.
tips: My identity is an astronaut
The event takes place in space
"Pants" refers to the spacesuit
Spacesuit damage led to fatal environmental exposure
Death caused by vacuum environment

bottom: A female student was learning to drive. The instructor said, "Have you adjusted your seat?" Then, learning began. The instructor said, "Fasten your seatbelt." The student tried to insert the seatbelt buckle into the instructor's seat. The instructor then said, "Wrong, wrong!"
tips: Ambiguous dialogue is actually driving instruction

title: Birthday
surface: Today is my 15th birthday. Tomorrow is my 13th birthday. The day after tomorrow is my 10th birthday. How can I have a birthday every day?
bottom: I am a staff member at a nursing home. We have many elderly residents suffering from Alzheimer's disease. Their children rarely visit them due to busy work schedules. Due to their longing and illness, they often mistake me for their daughter and pull me into celebrating their birthdays. This has led to me, almost forty years old, celebrating teenage birthdays for three consecutive days.
tips: I am a nursing home caregiver
Elderly residents have Alzheimer's disease
Residents mistake the caregiver for their child
Different ages correspond to different residents
Consecutive birthdays are due to multiple residents celebrating in turn

title: Proof of Guilt
surface: "I didn't kill anyone, I don't know how to use a shotgun!" "Unfortunately, that might just prove you are the killer."
bottom: The victim's cause of death was brain contusion caused by being struck in the back of the head with a gunstock, not from being shot with a shotgun. Because this person didn't know how to use a gun, they could only use the hunting rifle like a club. A regular shotgun is generally made of steel and walnut, weighing at least three kilograms or more. However, it doesn't rule out the possibility that someone who *does* know how to use a gun might adopt this method to avoid gunshots if they didn't bring a silencer.
tips: Cause of death was blunt force trauma, not gunshot
Shotgun stock was used as a club
Killer lacked experience in using firearms
Claiming inability to use a gun becomes a suspicious point

title: Hidden

bottom: I am ginger hidden in stewed meat. As is well known, ginger is a master of disguise in the culinary world. I was picked up by a diner, mistaken for meat, and put into their mouth. Indeed, being chewed into fragments is proof of ginger's excellent disguise.
tips: My true identity is a piece of ginger in stewed meat
"Hidden" refers to disguising my appearance as meat
"Caught and dismembered" refers to being mistakenly eaten and chewed by a diner
Being mistakenly eaten is proof of successful disguise
Successful disguise proves I was well hidden

bottom: The farmer was a skydiving enthusiast. One day, he went skydiving as usual, but because he hadn't checked beforehand, his parachute didn't deploy properly, causing him to descend at an extremely high speed. The last sight he saw was a wheat field.

title: Dictation
surface: The first six were correct, but why was the seventh wrong?
bottom: In Chinese class, the teacher asked everyone to dictate the Chinese characters for numbers one to seven. A foreign student couldn't dictate them, so he looked at the calendar next to him and copied 'Monday,' 'Tuesday,' and so on. However, he didn't realize that the seventh day isn't called '星期七' (xing qi qi - 'week seven'), but '星期日' (xing qi ri - 'Sunday')!
tips: The dictation content was Chinese numbers one to seven
The person who made the mistake was a foreign student
The student referred to a calendar for copying
The copied content was the Chinese expressions for days of the week
The error stemmed from the special name for the seventh day (Sunday)

title: Sea Turtle Soup
surface: A person went to a restaurant, ordered a bowl of sea turtle soup, and left the restaurant in a hurry without paying.
bottom: This person is a secret agent. His contact's cover identity is the owner and chef of a restaurant. The code to meet is to order sea turtle soup (which is actually chicken soup). On this day, the soup he drank tasted completely different from before, indicating it wasn't made by the same person. Yet, they could serve a bowl of 'sea turtle soup,' meaning his contact had been exposed, and the place was now controlled by enemies. He had no choice but to escape when no one was looking.
tips: The dish name 'Sea Turtle Soup' has a special meaning and does not refer to actual sea turtle soup.
The taste or preparation method of this soup was not as expected, and this point is very important.
This person's identity or profession is special, giving his actions (ordering a specific dish, leaving without paying) a specific purpose.
The reason he left was not because he forgot to pay or had no money, but because he sensed danger.
The restaurant's environment or serving staff might have changed, and this soup was a signal of that change.

title: Handgun
surface: He returned home and saw a woman holding a handgun, saying she was going to kill him.
bottom: He is a drama critic who once reviewed a male actor playing a murderer as having poor acting skills. This actor then disguised himself as a woman wanting to kill him and hid in his house. If he didn't realize the actor didn't actually want to kill him, it would prove the actor's acting skills.

The gun wielder's female appearance was a disguise.

This scene was a carefully arranged performance, not a real attack.
The gun wielder's purpose was to prove a certain professional skill to the man.

title: Valentine's Day
surface: On Valentine's Day, I received flowers from him, who was married, and cried my eyes out.
bottom: Since Grandma passed away last year, Grandpa has developed Alzheimer's disease and forgotten many things. Today is Valentine's Day. Grandpa quietly walked up to me, handed me a bouquet of roses, called out Grandma's name, and shyly spoke the old-fashioned sweet nothings he used to say to Grandma every Valentine's Day. I teared up, moved by their love and also missing my grandma.
tips: The flower giver mistook the recipient of the flowers.
The flower giver's behavior was influenced by memory or cognitive impairment.
This bouquet was originally intended for someone who is no longer alive.

title: Fortune Teller
surface: 'I don't want the accurate one, I want the inaccurate one,' I thought.
bottom: I am the housekeeper of a wealthy household. I embezzled the family heirloom. The wealthy master couldn't find it anywhere, so he asked me to find a fortune teller to divine where the heirloom went. I was afraid it would really be divined, so I decided to find an inaccurate fortune teller.

surface: I died in winter, I came alive in spring. I slept in summer, I flew in autumn.
bottom: I was killed in winter and buried in the earth. After spring, the ice melted, and maggots grew on my body. In summer, the maggots pupated, and in autumn, they turned into flies and flew away.

title: Husband Not Home
surface: 'Is your husband not home?' Red was everywhere. My husband came back, he was finished.
bottom:
The repairman came to my house to fix the electricity meter. When he was checking the meter box, his eyes looked a bit strange.
'Is your husband not home?' After getting a negative answer, he said he wanted to show me something good.
The meter box was completely opened, and many red banknotes fell out, covering my face. At this moment, my husband came back. How should I punish him?
tips: The overwhelming 'red' is not a symbol of danger or blood, but refers to some hidden item.
Asking 'Is your husband not home?' was not out of malice, but to create an opportunity to reveal a secret.

title: Taking out the Trash
surface: Mom is going to the hospital tomorrow, and I'm very scared. So I rush to take out the trash every day.
bottom: I once asked Mom where I came from. Mom told me I was picked up from a trash can, and I believed it. That day, Mom told me I would soon have a younger sibling. I was very worried that Mom would ignore me once the new sibling arrived. To prevent Mom from picking up a new sibling from the trash can, I rushed to take out the trash every day.
tips: The narrator's fear does not stem from concern about the hospital itself.
The act of taking out the trash is an attempt to prevent something from happening.
The narrator has a very literal and incorrect understanding of human origins.
Mom going to the hospital is related to the arrival of a new life, but this is misunderstood by the narrator.
The narrator's behavior stems from insecurity about losing maternal attention and naive logic.
